    literature review

    LR.Rmd

    First, take iris data as a reference for comparison. We generate the following test dataset 

    df <- iris
#df_missing and df_extra for less or more columns
df_missing <- df[, -which(names(df) %in% c("Species"))]
df_extra <- df
df_extra[, 6] = "extra"
#df_class for wrong class
df_class <- df
df_class$Species = as.character(df_class$Species)
#df_order for new order of same set of columns
df_order <- df[sample(nrow(df)), ]

    compareDF::compare_df() 

    #compareDF::compare_df(df, df_missing, c("Species"))
#compareDF::compare_df(df, df_extra, c("Species"))
#compareDF::compare_df(df, df_class, c("Species"))
#compareDF::compare_df(df, df_order, c("Species"))

    arsenal::comparedf() 

    arsenal::comparedf(df, df_missing)
#> Compare Object
#> 
#> Function Call: 
#> arsenal::comparedf(x = df, y = df_missing)
#> 
#> Shared: 4 non-by variables and 150 observations.
#> Not shared: 1 variables and 0 observations.
#> 
#> Differences found in 0/4 variables compared.
#> 0 variables compared have non-identical attributes.
arsenal::comparedf(df, df_extra)
#> Compare Object

#> Shared: 5 non-by variables and 150 observations.
#> Not shared: 1 variables and 0 observations.

#> 0 variables compared have non-identical attributes.
arsenal::comparedf(df, df_class)

arsenal::comparedf(df, df_order)

    dplyr::all_equal() 

    dplyr::all_equal(df, df_missing)
#> Different number of columns: 5 vs 4.
dplyr::all_equal(df, df_extra)
#> Different number of columns: 5 vs 6.
dplyr::all_equal(df, df_class)
#> Different types for column `Species`: factor<fb977> vs character.
dplyr::all_equal(df, df_class, convert = TRUE)
#> [1] TRUE
dplyr::all_equal(df, df_order)
#> [1] TRUE

    janitor::compare_df_cols() 

    janitor::compare_df_cols(df, df_missing, df_extra, df_class, df_order)
#>    column_name      df df_missing  df_extra  df_class df_order
#> 1 Petal.Length numeric    numeric   numeric   numeric  numeric
#> 2  Petal.Width numeric    numeric   numeric   numeric  numeric
#> 3 Sepal.Length numeric    numeric   numeric   numeric  numeric
#> 4  Sepal.Width numeric    numeric   numeric   numeric  numeric
#> 5      Species  factor       <NA>    factor character   factor
#> 6           V6    <NA>       <NA> character      <NA>     <NA>

    vetr::alike() 

    vetr::alike(df, df_missing)
#> [1] "`df_missing` should have 5 columns (has 4)"
vetr::alike(df, df_extra)
#> [1] "`df_extra` should have 5 columns (has 6)"
vetr::alike(df, df_class)
#> [1] "`df_class$Species` should be class \"factor\" (is \"character\")"
vetr::alike(df, df_order)
#> [1] "`length(row.names(df_order))` should be 2 (is 150)"

    diffdf::diffdf() 

    diffdf::diffdf(df, df_missing)
